text.section: Except as provided in § 17-307 of this subtitle, to qualify for a license to practice clinical professional counseling, an applicant shall be an individual who meets the requirements of this section.
The applicant shall be of good moral character.
The applicant shall be at least 18 years old.

section.section: The applicant shall hold a master's or doctoral degree in a professional counseling field from an accredited educational institution that is approved by the Board.

In the case of an applicant holding only a master's degree, the applicant shall have completed:
A minimum of 60 graduate credit hours in counselor training in the areas set forth in paragraph (2) of this subsection; and
Not less than 3 years, with a minimum of 3,000 hours, of supervised experience in counseling approved by the Board, 2 years of which shall have been completed after the award of the master's degree.

text.section: The applicant shall provide documentation evidencing the completion of 2 years of postgraduate supervised experience as required by the Board.
Except as otherwise provided in this title, the applicant shall pass an examination approved by the Board.
